USAGE: /record
→Opens and closes the Duty Recorder interface.<tab>/record<tab><tab>/record<tab>

USAGE: /recordready [subcommand]
→Opens and closes the Duty Recorder interface.
>>Subcommands: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>[countdowntime]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Initiate a record ready check to begin recording a duty. When all party members consent to the recording, a countdown will start at the specified time. Subsequent uses of this command during the same duty will function as both a ready check and countdown.
Opens the Duty Recorder interface when no subcommand is specified.<tab>/recordready<tab><tab>/recordready<tab>

USAGE: /pvpteamcmd
→Opens and closes the PvP team menu.<tab><tab><tab>/pvpteamcmd<tab>

USAGE: /saddlebag
→Opens and closes your chocobo saddlebag.<tab>/saddlebag<tab><tab>/saddlebag<tab>

USAGE: /magiaright
→Spins your magia board clockwise.<tab><tab><tab>/magiaright<tab>

USAGE: /magialeft
→Spins your magia board counterclockwise.<tab><tab><tab>/magialeft<tab>

ALIASES: /cwlinkshellcmd, /cwlcmd USAGE: /cwlinkshellcmd
→Opens and closes the Cross-world Linkshell window.<tab>/cwlinkshellcmd<tab>/cwlcmd<tab>/cwlinkshellcmd<tab>/cwlcmd

ALIASES: /quickchat, /qchat USAGE: /quickchat [quick chat message]
→Sends a Quick Chat message. Can only be used during Crystalline Conflict.
>>Example: /quickchat Charge <t> (Sends the Quick Chat message "Charge" using a specified target.)<tab>/quickchat<tab>/qchat<tab>/quickchat<tab>/qchat

USAGE: /bluespellbook [subcommand]
→Open and register active actions in the Blue Magic Spellbook.
>>Subcommands: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>set "blue mage action" on<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Adds the specified blue mage action to the list of active actions in the current set. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var> set "blue mage action" off<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Removes the specified blue mage action from the list of active actions in the current set. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>preset [active set 1-5]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Load the specified set of active actions. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>clear<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Remove all active actions from the current active action set.
Opens the Blue Magic Spellbook when no subcommand is specified.
>>Examples: /bluespellbook set “Water Cannon” (Sets the blue mage action Water Cannon as an active action in the current set.
/bluespellbook preset 2 (Loads active set 2.)<tab><tab><tab>/bluespellbook<tab>

USAGE: /magiaattack [placeholder]
→Spin the magia board to match the elemental weakness of the specified target. If no target is specified, matches based on current target.
>>Common Placeholders: <t>, <target>, <1>-<8>
A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.<tab><tab><tab>/magiaattack<tab>

USAGE: /magiadefense [placeholder]
→Spin the magia board to match the elemental affinity of the specified target. If no target is specified, matches based on current target.
>>Common Placeholders: <t>, <target>, <1>-<8>
A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.<tab><tab><tab>/magiadefense<tab>

USAGE: /magiaauto [subcommand]
→Set the magia board to automatically spin based on your current target.
>>Subcommands: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>attack (atk)<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Automatically spin the magia board to match the elemental weakness of current target. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>defense (def)<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Automatically spin the magia board to match the elemental affinity of current target. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>off <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Disable automatic spinning.
Toggle between attack, defense, and off when no subcommand is specified.<tab><tab><tab>/magiaauto<tab>

USAGE: /dice [chat mode] [subcommand]
→Displays a random number between 0 and 999 in the specified chat channel. Displays in the current chat mode when no chat mode is specified.
>>Chat Modes: Party <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>party<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>p<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Alliance <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>alliance<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>al<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Free Company <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>freecompany<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>fc<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> PvP Team <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>pvpteam<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>pt<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Linkshell <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>linkshell1-8<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>l1-8<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Cross-world Linkshell <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>cwlinkshell1-8<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>cwl1-8<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
>>Subcommands: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>[upper limit]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set an upper limit to display a random number between 1 and the specified number. Displays a random number between 0 and 999 when no upper limit is specified. Upper limit range: 2-999
>>Examples: /dice (Displays a random number in the current chat mode.)
/dice 16 (Displays a random number between 1 and 16 in the current chat mode.)
/dice cwl1 (Displays a random number in the Cross-world Linkshell 1 channel.)
/dice cwl1 16 (Displays a random number between 1 and 16 in the Cross-world Linkshell 1 channel.)<tab><tab><tab>/dice<tab>

USAGE: /nameplatetype [category] [setting number]
→Change PC display type settings.
>>Category: All Players <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>all<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Your Character <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>self<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Party Members <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>party<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Other PCs <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>other<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Friends <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>friend<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Crystalline Conflict Opponents <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>feast<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
>>Setting Number 1: Full Name 2: Surname Abbreviated 3: Forename Abbreviated 4: Initials
>>Example: /nameplatetype all 4 (Set display names to initials for all players.)<tab><tab><tab>/nameplatetype<tab>

USAGE: /nameplatedisp [category] [setting number]
→Change PC display name settings.
>>Category: All Players <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>all<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Your Character <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>self<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Party Members <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>party<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Other PCs <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>other<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Friends <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>friend<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Crystalline Conflict Opponents <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>feast<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
>>Setting Number 1: Always 2: During Battle 3: When Targeted 4: Never
>>Example: /nameplatedisp all 4 (Set display names to never display for all players.)<tab><tab><tab>/nameplatedisp<tab>

ALIASES: /petglamour, /petglam, /egiglamour USAGE: /petglamour [summon] [glamour]
→Alter the appearance of select summons. You must resummon the egi for the glamour to take effect. Command not applicable in PvP instances.
>>Summon Name: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Carbuncle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Garuda-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Titan-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Ifrit-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Eos<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
>>Glamour: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Carbuncle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Emerald Carbuncle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Topaz Carbuncle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Ruby Carbuncle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Garuda-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Titan-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Ifrit-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Selene<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
The glamour will be removed when no glamour is specified. Displays pet glamour settings in chat log when no subcommand is specified.
>>Example: /petglamour "Garuda-Egi" "Ruby Carbuncle" (Garuda-Egi will appear glamoured as Ruby Carbuncle.) /petglamour "Garuda-Egi" (Returns Garuda-Egi to default appearance.) /petglamour (Displays pet glamour settings.)<tab>/petglamour<tab>/petglam<tab>/petmirage<tab>

USAGE: /petsize [summon] [size]
→Alter the size of select summons. Command not applicable in PvP instances. These settings will not apply to other players.
>>Egi Name: Demi-Bahamut Demi-Phoenix Ruby Ifrit Topaz Titan Emerald Garuda Solar Bahamut all
>>Size: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>large<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set summon size to large. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>medium<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set summon size to medium. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>small<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set summon size to small.
Toggles between small, medium, and large when no size is specified. Returns an error when attempting to toggle using “all.”
>>Example: /petsize "Ruby Ifrit" "small" (Set Ruby Ifrit's size to small.)<tab><tab><tab>/petsize<tab>

USAGE: /ridepillion [placeholder] [subcommand]
→Ride pillion on a selected party member's mount.
>>Subcommands: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>[seat number]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Select your desired seat on the mount. Available options: 1-7
>>Common Placeholders: <t>, <target>, <1>-<8>
If the desired seat is already selected, you will be placed in the next available seat. Seat 1 will be selected if unspecified.
>>Example: /ridepillion <2> 1 (Ride in seat 1 of party member 2.)<tab><tab><tab>/ridepillion<tab>

USAGE: /patchnote
→Opens the Patch Notes page on the official site.
Launches using your default browser.<tab><tab><tab>/patchnote<tab>

USAGE: /rclickpc [subcommand]
→Sets right-click selection to allow or ignore PC targets.
>>Subcommands: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>on <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Disables right-click selection for PCs. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>off <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Enables right-click selection for PCs.
Toggles between on and off when no subcommand is specified.<tab><tab><tab>/rclickpc<tab>

USAGE: /rclickbattlenpc [subcommand]

Toggles between on and off when no subcommand is specified.<tab><tab><tab>/rclickbattlenpc<tab>

ALIASES: /pvpteam, /pt USAGE: /pvpteam [message]
→Sends a message to all members of your PvP team, regardless of their location. Typing /pvpteam or /pt without a message switches the default chat mode to [PvP Team].
>>Examples: /pvpteam Hello (Sends the message "Hello" to your PvP team.)
/pvpteam (Switches the default chat mode to [PvP Team].)<tab><tab><tab>/pvpteam<tab>/pt

ALIASES: /cwlinkshell, /cwl USAGE: /cwlinkshell [message]
→Sends a message to all members of your active cross-world linkshell, regardless of their location. Typing /cwlinkshell or /cwl without a message switches the default chat mode to your active cross-world linkshell channel.<tab><tab><tab>/cwlinkshell<tab>/cwl

ALIASES: /novice, /n USAGE: /novice [message]
→Sends a message to the [Novice Network]. The message will not be displayed if a PC has deselected [Novice Network] in the chat filter. Typing /novice or /n without a message switches the default chat mode to [Novice Network].
>>Examples: /novice Hello (Sends the message "Hello" to the Novice Network.)
/novice (Switches the default chat mode to [Novice Network].)<tab>/novice<tab>/n<tab>/beginner<tab>/b

ALIASES: /say, /s USAGE: /say [message]
→Sends a message to all PCs within a small radius. The message will not be displayed if a PC has deselected [Say] in the chat filter. Typing /say or /s without a message switches the default chat mode to [Say].<tab><tab><tab>/say<tab>/s

ALIASES: /shout, /sh USAGE: /shout [message]
→Sends a message to all PCs in the same area. The message will not be displayed if a PC has deselected [Shout] in the chat filter.<tab><tab><tab>/shout<tab>/sh

ALIASES: /tell, /t USAGE: /tell [PC name]@[World name] [message]
→Sends a message to a specific PC on a specified World. When specifying a World other than your own, the message can only be sent to PCs that are on your friend list or recruiting party members via the Party Finder. This message cannot be seen by other PCs, and will not be displayed if [Tell] is deselected in the chat filter. Typing /tell or /t [PC name]@[World name] without a message switches the default chat mode to [Tell].
>>Example: /tell [PC name]@Bahamut Hello (Sends the message "Hello" to [PC name] on the World Bahamut.)<tab><tab><tab>/tell<tab>/t

ALIASES: /party, /p USAGE: /party [message]
→Sends a message to all members of your current party, regardless of their location. The message will not be displayed if a PC has deselected [Party] in the chat filter. Typing /party or /p without a message switches the default chat mode to [Party].<tab><tab><tab>/party<tab>/p

USAGE: /invite [placeholder]

USAGE: /leader [placeholder]

USAGE: /leave
→Leave your current party.<tab><tab><tab>/leave<tab>

ALIASES: /check, /c USAGE: /check [placeholder]
→Examines the specified PC. Examines current target when no PC is specified.
>>Common Placeholders: <t>, <target>, <1>-<8>
A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.<tab><tab><tab>/check<tab>/c

USAGE: /trade [placeholder]
→Initiates a trade with the specified PC. Initiates a trade with your current target when no PC is specified.
>>Common Placeholders: <t>, <target>, <1>-<8>
A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.<tab><tab><tab>/trade<tab>

USAGE: /automove [subcommand]
→Begin moving in the current direction you are facing.
>>Subcommands: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>on <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Initiate automove. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>off <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Cancel automove.
Toggle between on and off when no subcommand is specified.<tab><tab><tab>/automove<tab>

USAGE: /follow
→Automatically follow a specified PC. Follow current target when no PC is specified.<tab><tab><tab>/follow<tab>

USAGE: /meldrequest [placeholder]
→Sends a materia meld request to the specified PC. Sends request to current target when no PC is specified.
>>Common Placeholders: <t>, <target>, <1>-<8>
A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.<tab><tab><tab>/meldrequest<tab>

ALIASES: /partycmd, /pcmd USAGE: /partycmd [subcommand]
→Executes various party commands. Can only be used to display the Party menu or add party members when participating in a cross-world party.
>>Subcommands: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>join<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Accept a party invite. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>decline<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Decline a party invite. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>add [placeholder]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Invite a PC to your party. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>leave<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Leave your current party. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>kick [placeholder]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Oust a PC from your party. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>breakup <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Dissolve your current party.
Opens and closes the Party menu when no subcommand is specified.
>>Common Placeholders: <t>, <target>, <1>-<8>
A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.<tab><tab><tab>/partycmd<tab>/pcmd

ALIASES: /friendlist, /flist USAGE: /friendlist [subcommand]
→Executes various friend list commands.
>>Subcommands: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>add [placeholder]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Send a PC a friend request. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>accept [placeholder]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Accept a friend request from a PC. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>deny [placeholder]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Deny a friend request from a PC. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>remove [placeholder]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Remove a PC from your friend list.
Opens and closes friend list when no subcommand is specified.
>>Common Placeholders: <t>, <target>, <1>-<8>
A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.<tab><tab><tab>/friendlist<tab>/flist

ALIASES: /blacklist, /blist USAGE: /blacklist [subcommand]
→Executes various blacklist commands.
>>Subcommands: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>add [placeholder]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Add an account tied to a designated PC to your blacklist. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>remove [placeholder]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Remove an account tied to a designated PC from your blacklist.
Opens and closes blacklist when no subcommand is specified.
>>Common Placeholders: <t>, <target>, <1>-<8>
A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.<tab><tab><tab>/blacklist<tab>/blist

ALIASES: /enemysign, /marking, /mk USAGE: /enemysign [sign type] [placeholder]
→Set a sign on the specified target. Uses current target when not specified.
>>Sign Types: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>attack1-8<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>bind1-3<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>ignore1-2<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>circle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>cross<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>square<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>triangle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var> off<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>/<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>clear<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Turns off sign.
Opens and closes the Signs menu when no subcommand is specified.
>>Common Placeholders: <t>, <target>, <1>-<8>
A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.
>>Example: /marking attack2 <t> (Assigns "Target to Attack 2" to target.)<tab>/enemysign<tab><tab>/marking<tab>/mk

ALIASES: /waymark, /wmark USAGE: /wmark [subcommand] [placeholder]
→Place a waymark on the ground below a target. If no target is specified, you will enter ground targeting mode ready to place a waymark.
>>Subcommands: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>a <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Place or remove waymark A. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>b <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Place or remove waymark B. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>c <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Place or remove waymark C. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>d<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Place or remove waymark D. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>1<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Place or remove waymark 1. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>2<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Place or remove waymark 2. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>3<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Place or remove waymark 3. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>4<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Place or remove waymark 4. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var> off<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>/<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>clear<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Remove all waymarks. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>save 1-30<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Save waymark placements to slots 1-30 of the Waymarks menu. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>preset 1-30<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Load waymark placements from slots 1-30 of the Waymarks menu.
You will enter ground targeting mode ready to place an unused waymark in the order of A-D, 1, 2 when no subcommand is specified. More than six waymarks cannot be placed at one time. If a target name is specified, a marker name must also be specified.
>>Common Placeholders: <t>, <target>, <1>-<8>, gtoff
A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.
>>Examples: /waymark A (Enters ground targeting mode ready to place waymark A.)
/waymark A <t> (Places waymark A at the selected target's location.)
/waymark A gtoff (Places waymark A at the mouse cursor's location.)<tab>/waymark<tab>/wmark<tab>/waymark<tab>/wmark

ALIASES: /gearset, /gs USAGE: /gearset [subcommand]
→Execute gear set functions.
>>Subcommands: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>change [number 1] [number 2] <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Equip gear in slot [number]. A gear set name can be specified in place of a slot number. If glamour plates are available, a plate number can also be specified. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>view [number] <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> List gear in slot [number]. A gear set name can be specified in place of a slot number. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>save [number] <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Save current gear to slot [number]. A gear set name can be specified in place of a slot number. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>delete [number] <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Delete slot [number]. A gear set name can be specified in place of a slot number.
First letter matching can be used when specifying gear sets by name. Gear sets will be searched in order from lowest slot number to highest. Gear set list will be displayed when no subcommand is specified.
>>Example: /gearset change 1 1 (Equip gear in slot 1 and cast glamour from plate 1.) /gearset change warrior (Equip gear slot whose name begins with warrior.) <tab><tab><tab>/gearset<tab>/gs

ALIASES: /itemsearch, /isearch USAGE: /isearch [item name]
→Conducts a complete search of your inventory for all items you own, including equipped gear, items held or equipped by retainers, and items stored in your Armoury Chest, saddlebag, armoire, and glamour dresser. Command cannot be used in a macro.
>>Example: /itemsearch "Potion" (Searches your inventory for items containing the word Potion.)<tab><tab><tab>/itemsearch<tab>/isearch

ALIASES: /idlingcamera, /icam USAGE: /icam [placeholder]
→Activate the idling camera. Target does not need to be specified. If a target is specified, the camera will switch between camera angles focusing on that target. If the specified target cannot be focused on, then a random subject will be chosen.
>>Controls Open the Camera Settings interface <var 1E 0B /var>, R, NUM*, Wheel Button
Pause/unpause camera <var 1E 09 /var>, NUM0, left-click
Skip scene <var 1E 07 /var>, Tab, Shift+Tab
Adjust frame composition <var 1E 15 /var>, W, A, S, D, Q, E
Reset frame composition <var 12 11 /var>, Z
>>Common Placeholders: <t>, <target>, <1>-<8>
A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.<tab><tab><tab>/idlingcamera<tab>/icam

→Alter the appearance of select summons. You must resummon the egi for the glamour to take effect. Command not applicable in PvP instances.
>>Summon Name: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Carbuncle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Garuda-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Titan-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Ifrit-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Eos<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
>>Glamour: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Carbuncle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Emerald Carbuncle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Topaz Carbuncle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Ruby Carbuncle<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Garuda-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Titan-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Ifrit-Egi<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Selene<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

USAGE: /alarm "name" [clock type] [repeat] [time] [reminder] [sound effect] [mute]
→Set an alarm for a specified time using local, server, or Eorzea time.
>>Clock Type: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>lt<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the alarm using local time. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>st<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the alarm using server time. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>et<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the alarm using Eorzea time.
>>Repeat: Use "repeat" or "rp" to set an hourly alarm.
>>Time: Times must be set using the 24- hour clock. Time values: 0000-2400 The hour must be omitted when using the repeat subcommand.
>>Reminder: A notification can be given up to 60 minutes prior to the alarm. Time values: 0-60
>>Sound Effect: Play a designated sound effect. Sound effect values: 00-05
>>Mute: Mute sound effects while undertaking duties.
The repeat, reminder, sound effect, and mute subcommands can be omitted. The "clear" subcommand can be used to delete all alarms. Opens the alarm interface when no subcommands are specified.
>>Examples: /alarm Raid lt 2000 10 se04 (Sets the "Raid" alarm for 20:00 local time, with a notification given 10 minutes prior.)
/alarm Party lt rp 30 se05 (Sets the "Party" alarm as an hourly alarm, 30 minutes past the hour in local time.)<tab><tab><tab>/alarm<tab>

ALIASES: /action, /ac USAGE: /action "action name" [placeholder]
→Uses an action on the specified PC. Uses current target when not specified. Target does not need to be specified for certain actions. This cannot be used with actions you have not yet learned, or when restricted by other factors. If action uses ground targeting, then the action will be executed according to the specified placeholder. If no placeholder is specified, then you will enter ground targeting mode.
>>Common Placeholders: <t>, <target>, <1>-<8>, gtoff
A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.
>>Examples: /action "Heavy Swing" <t> (Executes Heavy Swing on current target.)
/action "Cure" <2> (Executes Cure on second player in party list.) /action "Earthly Star" gtoff (Executes Earthly Star at mouse cursor's location.)<tab><tab><tab>/action<tab>/ac

ALIASES: /battlemode, /bm USAGE: /battlemode [subcommand]
→Toggle between active and passive mode.
>>Subcommands: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>on <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Switch to active mode. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>off <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Switch to passive mode.
Toggle between active and passive mode when no subcommand is specified.<tab><tab><tab>/battlemode<tab>/bm

ALIASES: /target, /ta USAGE: /target [placeholder]
→Targets the specified PC. Target must be within a certain radius for this command to function.
>>Common Placeholders: <t>, <target>, <1>-<8>
A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.
>>Example: /target <2> (Targets second player in player list.)<tab><tab><tab>/target<tab>/ta

ALIASES: /petaction, /pac USAGE: /pac "pet action name" [placeholder]
→Uses a pet action on the specified target. Uses current target when not specified. Target does not need to be specified for certain pet actions. This cannot be used with pet actions you have not yet learned, or when restricted by other factors.
>>Common Placeholders: <t>, <target>, <1>-<8>
A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.
>>Example: /pac "Crimson Cyclone" <t> (Executes Crimson Cyclone on current target.)<tab><tab><tab>/petaction<tab>/pac

ALIASES: /companionaction, /cac USAGE: /cac "companion action name"

>>Example: /cac "free stance" (Companion will enter free stance.)<tab>/companionaction<tab>/cac<tab>/companionaction<tab>/cac

USAGE: /hotbar [subcommand]
→Edit and configure hotbar settings. Only available in PvE areas.
>>Subcommands <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>action "action name" [#1] [#2]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the specified action to slot [#2] in hotbar page [#1]. If "current" is entered for [#1], then the action will be set in the page displayed in hotbar 1. If [#2] is omitted, the action will be set to the lowest-numbered slot available. If both [#1] and [#2] are omitted, the action will be set to the lowest-numbered slot available on the lowest-numbered hotbar available. This applies to all of the following subcommands. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>blueaction "blue mage action name" [#1] [#2]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the specified blue mage action to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>general "general action name" [#1] [#2]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the specified general action to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>item "item name" [#1] [#2]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the specified item to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>emote "emote name" [#1] [#2]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the specified emote to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>companion "companion action name" [#1] [#2]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the specified companion action to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>pet "action name" [#1] [#2]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the specified pet action to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>minion "minion name" [#1] [#2]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the specified minion to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>mount "mount name" [#1] [#2]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the specified mount to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>enemysign "enemy sign name" [#1] [#2]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the specified enemy sign to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>waymark "waymark name" [#1] [#2]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the specified waymark to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>change [number]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Replace current hotbar with hotbar [number]. If "next" or "prev" is entered in [number], then you can scroll through the pages of hotbar 1. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>copy [class 1] [#1] [class 2] [#2]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Copy the contents of [class 1] hotbar [#1] to the [class 2] hotbar [#2]. The subcommand "current" can be used to specify your current class. The subcommand "share" can be used instead of a class to specify your shared hotbar. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>display [number] on<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Display hotbar [number]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>display [number] off<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Hide hotbar [number]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>display [number]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Toggle on/off hotbar [number]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>share [number] on<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Make hotbar [number] shared. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>share [number] off<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Unshare hotbar [number] and assign it to your current class/job. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>share [number]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Toggle between on/off. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>remove [#1] [#2]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Remove the action assigned to slot [#2] on hotbar [#1]. Replace [#2] with "all" to remove all actions from hotbar [#1].
>>Examples: /hotbar action "Mount Roulette" 1 1 (Places Mount Roulette in slot [#1] on hotbar [#1].)
/hotbar change 2 (Replaces hotbar [#1] with hotbar [#2].)<tab><tab><tab>/hotbar<tab>

USAGE: /hudreset
→Reverts the current HUD layout, size, and transparency to the default settings.<tab><tab><tab>/hudreset<tab>

USAGE: /uireset
→Reverts all HUD layouts to the default setting, and returns all windows to their default positions, sizes, and transparencies.<tab><tab><tab>/uireset<tab>

USAGE: /uiscale [subcommand]
→Resize current HUD elements and windows.
>>Subcommands: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>[number] <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Resize all HUD elements and windows to the percentage equivalent to the number specified. Percentages available: 60, 80, 90, 100, 110, 120, 140. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>reset <var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Reset all HUD elements to default size.
>>Examples: /uiscale 140 (All HUD elements become 40 percent larger than their default size.) /uiscale reset (Restores all HUD elements to their default size.)<tab><tab><tab>/uiscale<tab>

If "current" is entered for [number], the action will be set in the currently displayed cross hotbar. If [slot name] is omitted, the action will be set to the lowest-numbered slot available. If both [number] and [slot name] are omitted, the action will be set to the lowest-numbered slot available on the lowest-numbered cross hotbar available. This applies to all of the following subcommands. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>general "general action name" [number] [slot name]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the specified general action to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>item "item name" [number] [slot name]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the specified item to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>emote "emote name" [number] [slot name]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the specified emote to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>companion "companion action name" [number] [slot name]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the specified companion action to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>pet "action name" [number] [slot name]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the specified pet action to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>minion "minion name" [number] [slot name]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the specified minion to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>mount "mount name" [number] [slot name]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the specified mount to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>enemysign "enemy sign name" [number] [slot name]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the specified enemy sign to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>waymark "waymark name" [number] [slot name]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Set the specified waymark to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>change [number]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Replace current cross hotbar with cross hotbar [number]. Enter "prev" or "next" for [number] to scroll through the cross hotbars. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>copy [job 1] [number 1] [job 2] [number 2]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Copy the contents of [job 1] cross hotbar [number 1] to the [job 2] cross hotbar [number 2]. The subcommand "current" can be used to specify your current job. The subcommand "share" can be used instead of a job to specify your shared cross hotbar. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>display [number] on<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Display cross hotbar [number]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>display [number] off<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Hide cross hotbar [number]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>display [number]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Toggle on/off cross hotbar [number]. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>share [number] on<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Make cross hotbar [number] shared. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>share [number] off<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Unshare cross hotbar [number] and assign it to your current job. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>share [number]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Toggle between on/off. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>remove [number] [slot name]<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Remove the action assigned to [slot name] on cross hotbar [number]. Replace [slot name] with "all" to remove all actions from cross hotbar [number].

ALIASES: /sit, /lounge USAGE: /sit
→Assume a sitting position.
Certain emotes have special sitting equivalents. Also sits your character in a chair if the chair is nearby.<tab>/sit<tab>/lounge<tab>/lounge<tab>/sit

USAGE: /groundsit
→Assume a sitting position.
Certain emotes have special sitting equivalents. Does not sit your character in a chair even if the chair is nearby.<tab><tab><tab>/groundsit<tab>

USAGE: /airquotes
→Make air quotes with your fingers for added sarcasm, emphasis, etc. No system message is displayed with this emote.<tab><tab><tab>/airquotes<tab>

USAGE: /gcsalute [subcommand]
→Perform an official Maelstrom salute.
>>Subcommands: <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>motion<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Perform motion only.
Both text and motion will be displayed when no subcommand is specified.<tab><tab><tab>/gcsalute<tab>
